pr_title: Provide view metadata to the Hive Metastore

timeline.bodyText: This interface (unlike ConnectorMetadata) is entirely internal to Presto. You can directly change the old createView method instead of adding a new one.
timeline.author: rschlussel

timeline.bodyText: As discussed, undo changes from this file
timeline.author: rschlussel

timeline.bodyText:
the default implementation should call the other version of createView().  Also, as discussed

mark that other one as deprecated
implement this version for all the connectors in Presto that had implemented the other one.
timeline.author: rschlussel

timeline.bodyText: this code should never be called. throw an IllegalStateException
timeline.author: rschlussel

timeline.bodyText: view metadata should never be null, so we can simplify this
timeline.author: rschlussel

timeline.bodyText: use ImmutableSet.of() to create an empty hashSet
timeline.author: rschlussel

replies.bodyText:
Also, actually, maybe instead of calling getColumnHandles, call the type translator directly on the ColumnMetadata, since all we need from it is the type translation.
Something like
List<Column> columns = viewColumnMetadata.stream()
    .map(column-> new Column(column.getName, toHiveType(typeTranslator, column.getType(), column.getComment())
    .collect(toImmutableList())
replies.author: rschlussel

timeline.bodyText: I don't think these changes are needed.  getBucketProperty isn't called by getColumnHandles().  (and also, suggested not calling getColumnHandles() anyway)
timeline.author: rschlussel

timeline.bodyText:
ConnectorTableMetadata includes the SchemaTableName, so you don't need both.
Either make the signature:
createView(ConnectorSession session, SchemaTableName viewName, List<ColumnMetadata> columnMetadata, String viewData, boolean replace)
or make it more similar to createTable() like
createView(ConnectorSession session, ConnectorTableMetadata viewMetadata, String viewData, boolean replace)
timeline.author: rschlussel

timeline.bodyText: remove the dummyColumn
timeline.author: cploonker

timeline.bodyText: Why do we even need 2 methods? It feels like we should simply migrate.
timeline.author: arhimondr

replies.bodyText: I think we should have a deprecation period since this is an spi change in case there are external connectors that need to migrate.
replies.author: rschlussel

replies.bodyText: We are trying to do our best to do not make any breaking changes, however I'm not sure if the delay is going to be really helpful. But from the other side it will make the SPI more messy. Anyhow, I don't have a strong opinion here. We can keep the old SPI method.
replies.author: arhimondr

replies.bodyText: That's fair.  People can just as easily wait to upgrade until they fix their connectors.  @ucalegon206, let's remove the deprecated method entirely
replies.author: rschlussel

timeline.bodyText:
Nit: Extract viewMetadata.getTable() as a variable to reuse since it's called a lot of times.  something like
SchemaTableName viewName = viewMetadata.getTable();
timeline.author: rschlussel
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -1671,14 +1678,16 @@ public void createView(ConnectorSession session, SchemaTableName viewName, Strin
                 .put(PRESTO_QUERY_ID_NAME, session.getQueryId())
                 .build();
 
-        Column dummyColumn = new Column("dummy", HIVE_STRING, Optional.empty());
+        List<Column> columns = viewMetadata.getColumns().stream()
+                .map(col -> new Column(col.getName(), toHiveType(typeTranslator, col.getType()), Optional.ofNullable(col.getComment())))
+                        .collect(toImmutableList());
 
         Table.Builder tableBuilder = Table.builder()
-                .setDatabaseName(viewName.getSchemaName())
-                .setTableName(viewName.getTableName())
+                .setDatabaseName(viewMetadata.getTable().getSchemaName())

replies.bodyText: LOL, yeah... this really makes sense. Thanks for catching it.
replies.author: ucalegon206

timeline.bodyText: nit: undo change to this file
timeline.author: rschlussel

timeline.bodyText: nit: call this columnMetadata (lower case d) since everywhere else "metadata" is considered one word
timeline.author: rschlussel
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -88,9 +90,14 @@ public String explain(CreateView statement, List<Expression> parameters)
                 .map(field -> new ViewColumn(field.getName().get(), field.getType()))
                 .collect(toImmutableList());
 
+        List<ColumnMetadata> columnMetaData = columns.stream()

timeline.bodyText: throw an IllegalStateException for the deprecated version since it should never be called.
timeline.author: rschlussel

timeline.bodyText: this version should call the deprecated version by default
timeline.author: rschlussel
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -499,7 +499,16 @@ default void finishDelete(ConnectorSession session, ConnectorTableHandle tableHa
     /**
      * Create the specified view. The data for the view is opaque to the connector.
      */
+    @Deprecated
     default void createView(ConnectorSession session, SchemaTableName viewName, String viewData, boolean replace)
+    {
+        createView(session, (ConnectorTableMetadata) null, viewData, replace);
+    }
+
+    /**
+     * Create the specified view. The data for the view is opaque to the connector.
+     */
+    default void createView(ConnectorSession session, ConnectorTableMetadata viewMetadata, String viewData, boolean replace)

timeline.bodyText: this version should throw the exception by default
timeline.author: rschlussel

replies.bodyText: Ok, I didn't catch that. Would this work for you? throw new IllegalStateException("Deprecated createView method call");
replies.author: ucalegon206

replies.bodyText: no, this should be the original exception it was throwing about unsupported views.  the basic flow is we call the new method, if it's not overridden we call the old method, if that isn't overridden we say views aren't supported.
replies.author: rschlussel

timeline.bodyText: nit: move this above where data is set, so this is right next to the columnMetadata creation and the createView() arguments are created in the order they appear.
timeline.author: rschlussel

timeline.bodyText: You should simply remove this method. It has a default implementation in the interface that throws an UnsupportedOperationException.  Same for other connectors.
timeline.author: arhimondr

timeline.bodyText: Ditto. Simply remove it.
timeline.author: arhimondr

timeline.bodyText: This should also be removed. It is never called by the engine.
timeline.author: arhimondr

timeline.message: Provide view metadata to the Hive Metastore
Provide view metadata to the Hive Metastore
